result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Genesis Marie Burgos

records.addlTxt: No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CM.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Genesis Marie Burgos in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
